titleStmt.title: Gradus Simeonis: or, The first-fruits of Philip, Earle of Pembroke and Montgomery, &c. sometimes Knight of the Garter: and now Knight of Berk-Shire. Presented in a learned speech upon the day of his ascending downe into the lower House of Commons.

Gradus Simeonis: or, The first-fruits of Philip, Earle of Pembroke and Montgomery, &c. sometimes Knight of the Garter: and now Knight of Berk-Shire. Presented in a learned speech upon the day of his ascending downe into the lower House of Commons.

publicationStmt.date: In the first year of the Lords freedome [i.e. 1649]

notesStmt.note: A satire on Pembroke's first speech in the House of Commons.
The words "sometimes" and "now" are each enclosed in square brackets on title page.
Place and date of publication from Wing.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
